list_definition.definition: to bring (the foot) down with force (on the ground)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He stamped his foot with rage

list_definition.definition: to print or mark on to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He stamped the date at the top of his letter
The oranges were all stamped with the exporter’s name.

list_definition.definition: to stick a postage stamp on (a letter etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve addressed the envelope but haven’t stamped it.

list_definition.definition: an act of stamping the foot

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: ‘Give it to me!’ she shouted with a stamp of her foot.

list_definition.definition: the instrument used to stamp a design etc on a surface

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He marked the date on the bill with a rubber date-stamp.
He stuck the stamps on the parcel

list_definition.definition: a design etc made by stamping

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: All the goods bore the manufacturer’s stamp.
